data.title: Movie
data.text: It's all we got so it has to do ! Not to bad for a small city that is growing and it looks much better than it use to . I say we are coming on up !

data.title: As Theater's Go, Not Bad
data.text:
The Bowling Green 12 is not a bad theater (much better than the 10 located at the mall) however to other theater's that I have attended around the country it needs some updating, price changes and more comfortable seats.

Service has always been polite...the length of the previews are too long (sometimes over 8 "coming attractions" will be shown before show begins). this can run an additional 20 to 30 minutes.

Dr. Marc, PS 63:7

data.title: Okay
data.text: Chairs seemed small and close together. Drinks and pop corn overpriced liked most cinemas. Clean restrooms. The place is dated

data.title: Nice Place To See A Movie
data.text:
We were on travel and needed a good place to see Star Wars - we decided to visit Regal Cinemas Bowling Green 12 based on Trip Advisor reviews - this is a clean, safe, a good place to see a movie.

Yes, it is older but the popcorn is good : ) 

If I lived in Bowling Green I would see movies here anytime!

data.title: Terrible Seats
data.text: The seats were very narrow and sit back so far they are difficult to get out of. There was also a stale smell in screen room #9. The screen was huge. The sound was very loud, but good.  The popcorn and service was great though.

data.title: Dirty and old looking with no soap or paper towels in women's bathrooms
data.text: I have never been to a movie theater that was so dirty and not have a stocked bathroom, no soap or hand towels in women's bathroom, it was a shame. For the price you pay for movies I know they can do better than this! Very disappointed in Regal. We were visiting for the weekend and I'm still amazed at how bad it was.

data.title: Great Variety of Movies
data.text: I'm a fan of movies and the Stadium 12 always has a great selection to choose from.  The staff is polite (both at the ticket counter and the snack bar.  Prices are reasonable and love the early ticket prices (also senior prices)

data.title: Movie Date
data.text: This was a fun, clean place to watch a movie and take a date. We had a great time! It's pretty run of the mill as far as prices go--but it's worth it to have a decent movie theater.

data.title: Strange practices
data.text:
Both theaters in Bowling Green have started the practice of not projecting any images, only sound, while you wait for the feature to start. Not always, but most of the time. After paying an exorbitant amount to get in, not to mention for any snacks you might buy, it really rubs me the wrong way to have to sit and listen to previews and commercials with no video. How do the people who paid for the ads feel about this?
The theater experience just keeps getting worse and worse, and this theater is leading the charge (pun intended).

data.title: Worst experience
data.text: I went to the movies for the first time in forever.  Wow are the prices insane.  The woman taking tickets was a real b.  Then had the pleasure of being attacked by fleas *,yes fleas in the theater.  Upon reporting this we were once again treated as though we were insane...  Really bad experience
